text: Two of the genes defective in the five complementation groups identified in the class II - negative bare lymphocyte syndrome or corresponding laboratory mutants have been cloned .
One gene encodes a protein , <extra_id_0> RFX5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , that is a member of the RFX family of DNA binding proteins .
The other , <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , encodes a large protein with a defined acidic transcriptional activation domain ; this protein does not interact with DNA .

Expression plasmids encoding regions of <extra_id_0> RFX5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fused to the <extra_id_0> GAL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA binding domain activated transcription from a reporter construct containing <extra_id_0> GAL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sites in a cotransfection assay in the Raji human B cell line .

However , these plasmids produced transcriptional activity in HeLa cells only in conjunction with <extra_id_0> interferon gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation , a condition in which expression of both <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and class II major histocompatibility complex surface proteins are induced .

text: Furthermore , these plasmids were not active in RJ2.2.5 , an in vitro mutagenized derivative of Raji in which both copies of <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are defective .

Transcriptional activation by the <extra_id_0> RFX5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fusion protein could be restored in RJ2.2.5 by cotransfection with a <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression plasmid .

text: Finally , a direct interaction between <extra_id_0> RFX5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was detected with the yeast two-hybrid and far-Western blot assays .

text: Thus , <extra_id_0> RFX5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can activate transcription only in cooperation with <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

<extra_id_0> RFX5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> associate to form a complex capable of activating transcription from class II major histocompatibility complex promoters .

text: In this complex , promoter specificity is determined by the DNA binding domain of <extra_id_0> RFX5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the general transcription apparatus is recruited by the acidic activation domain of <extra_id_0> CIITA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
